title: David Capewell
text:
<a href="Lieutenant-general%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">Lieutenant General</a> Sir David Andrew Capewell, (born 21 August 1959) is a retired <a href="Royal%20Marines">Royal Marines</a> officer who served as <a href="Chief%20of%20Joint%20Operations%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">Chief of Joint Operations</a> from 2011 to 2015.
Early life and education.
Capewell was born on 21 August 1959 in <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a>, Yorkshire, England. He was educated at <a href="Holme%20Valley%20Grammar%20School">Holme Valley Grammar School</a>, a <a href="grammar%20school">grammar school</a> in <a href="Holme%20Valley">Holme Valley</a>, Yorkshire.
Military career.
Capewell was <a href="commissioned%20officer">commissioned</a> into the <a href="Royal%20Marines">Royal Marines</a> in 1979, holding a special short-service commission. He was confirmed in the rank of lieutenant on 1 September 1983 (seniority from 1 February), and was transferred to a full career commission on 29 October 1985 (seniority from 1 February 1983).
As a junior officer, Capewell served in <a href="Northern%20Ireland">Northern Ireland</a>, <a href="Zimbabwe">Zimbabwe</a> and <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a>. He was promoted to <a href="major">major</a> on 31 December 1994. He became Chief of Staff of <a href="3%20Commando%20Brigade">3 Commando Brigade</a> in 1998. He was promoted to <a href="colonel">colonel</a> on 31 December 1999 and appointed <a href="Commanding%20Officer">Commanding Officer</a> of <a href="40%20Commando">40 Commando</a> in March 2000. In January 2002, he was appointed Chief of Staff, UK Joint Force Headquarters, in which role he served as Chief of Operations and Intelligence to the British Commander for the <a href="2003%20invasion%20of%20Iraq">invasion of Iraq</a>. He was appointed an <a href="Officer%20of%20the%20Order%20of%20the%20British%20Empire">Officer of the Order of the British Empire</a> in the <a href="2002%20Birthday%20Honours">2002 Birthday Honours</a> for service in Northern Ireland and <a href="Afghanistan">Afghanistan</a>.
Capewell went on to be British Liaison Officer to the <a href="Joint%20Chiefs%20of%20Staff">Joint Chiefs of Staff</a> in the United States in 2004, and was promoted to <a href="brigadier">brigadier</a> on 18 October 2004. He became Assistant Chief of Staff (Operations) at <a href="Permanent%20Joint%20Headquarters">Permanent Joint Headquarters</a> in May 2005 and Commander of <a href="3%20Commando%20Brigade">3 Commando Brigade</a> in June 2007. Promoted to <a href="Major-general%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">major general</a> on 6 May 2008, on his appointment as Deputy Commander <a href="NATO%20Rapid%20Deployable%20Corps%20-%20Italy">NATO Rapid Deployable Italian Corps</a>, he became <a href="Assistant%20Chief%20of%20the%20Defence%20Staff">Assistant Chief of the Defence Staff</a> (Operations) at the <a href="Ministry%20of%20Defence%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">Ministry of Defence</a> in August 2010 and <a href="Chief%20of%20Joint%20Operations%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">Chief of Joint Operations</a> at <a href="Permanent%20Joint%20Headquarters">Permanent Joint Headquarters</a> in December 2011, with the rank of <a href="lieutenant%20general">lieutenant general</a> from 13 December.
Capewell was appointed <a href="Knight%20Commander%20of%20the%20Order%20of%20the%20Bath">Knight Commander of the Order of the Bath</a> in the <a href="2014%20New%20Year%20Honours">2014 New Year Honours</a> for commanding UK Global Operations during a period of unprecedented volatility.
Family.
Capewell is married to Deborah and has two daughters.
